citations.narrative:
This facility recently acquired 2 bear cubs. The facility staff has no prior experience with maintaining and caring for bears
at the facility. The applicant has not taken steps to gain the experience and knowledge to maintain bears at the facility
prior to applying for a USDA license that authorizes bears. Adequate knowledge and experience are needed to ensure the
health and wellbeing of the bears and the safety of the staff and public. The licensee must demonstrate adequate
knowledge and experience for maintaining bears at the facility before a USDA license authorizing bears can be issued.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 17 June 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.131(a) 
   
Handling of animals. 
This facility recently acquired 2 bear cubs. The facility staff has no prior experience with maintaining and caring for bears 
at the facility. The applicant has not taken steps to gain the experience and knowledge to maintain bears at the facility 
prior to applying for a USDA license that authorizes bears. Adequate knowledge and experience are needed to ensure the 
health and wellbeing of the bears and the safety of the staff and public. The licensee must demonstrate adequate 
knowledge and experience for maintaining bears at the facility before a USDA license authorizing bears can be issued. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 17 June 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
